docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 20 -- Following a Cabinet meeting at which were considered Washington's offer of mediation and other, phases of the diplomatic conflict with Uruguay, Foreign Minister Saavedra Lamas stated emphatically today that Argentina would...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 20 -- Following a Cabinet meeting at which were considered Washington's offer of mediation and other, phases of the diplomatic conflict with Uruguay, Foreign Minister Saavedra Lamas stated emphatically today that Argentina would not accept an offer of the good offices from the United States or any other country, but would insist on settlement in accordance with the Treaty of Montevideo of 1889.
docs.abstract: Argentina rejects U S aid; says mediation would be violation of 1889 pact; Uruguay accepts U S offer; Wash explains that arbitration was not aim

headline.main: ARGENTINA REJECTS OUR AID IN DISPUTE; Says Mediation of Differences With Uruguay Would Be a Violation of 1889 Pact. DIRECT TALKS INSISTED ON Uruguay Accepts Our Offer and Washington Explains That Arbi- tration Was Not Aim.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 21. -- Representatives of the neutral Pan-American governments who have been assisting in efforts of Bolivia and Paraguay to draft a non-aggression treaty covering the disputed Chaco region appealed to those two countries today for...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 21. -- Representatives of the neutral Pan-American governments who have been assisting in efforts of Bolivia and Paraguay to draft a non-aggression treaty covering the disputed Chaco region appealed to those two countries today for peace in that region.

headline.main: MOVE TO BLOCK WAR IN THE CHACO AREA; Neutrals Call on Paraguay and Bolivia to Report Facts on Military Clashes. BOTH COUNTRIES RESOLUTE Each Insists the Other Took Advantage of Parleys to Act Aggressively Against Its Garrisons.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES, July 22 -- The Brazilian Olympic team continued to operate in the coffee business today. Required to sell 50,000 bags of coffee in order to pay their way to Los Angeles, the sixty-nine Brazilian athletes had only disposed of enough when...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, July 22 -- The Brazilian Olympic team continued to operate in the coffee business today. Required to sell 50,000 bags of coffee in order to pay their way to Los Angeles, the sixty-nine Brazilian athletes had only disposed of enough when they reached here this morning to permit twenty-four athletes -- oarsmen and track and field men -- to disembark from the government auxiliary, the steamship Itaquice, this evening.
docs.abstract: Brazilian team arrives; only 24 able to quit boat; rest go on coffee-selling tour to raise funds

headline.main: ONLY 24 OF SQUAD ABLE TO QUIT BOAT; Rest of South American Croup Go on Coffee-Selling Tour to Raise Needed Funds. 128 NATIONS NOW ON SCENE U.S. Team at Los Angeles Practi- cally Complete -- Sexton and Spitz Arrive.

byline.original: By ARTHUR J. DALEY.Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: THE development of international air navigation, whether in regular scheduled transport or in casual private travel, has had to steer a course between Scylla and Charybdis. On the one side lies the danger of regulation so stringent, and preservation...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE development of international air navigation, whether in regular scheduled transport or in casual private travel, has had to steer a course between Scylla and Charybdis. On the one side lies the danger of regulation so stringent, and preservation of national prerogatives so careful, that international flying will be swathed in red tape and stipulated out of existence.
docs.abstract: Feature article by E P Warner on need for new code for internatl navigation

headline.main: URGES NEW CODE OF AIR; E.P. Warner Holds Present Conventions on Rules Should Be Unified

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES, July 23. -- California's nine-year vigil is nearly over. The games of the tenth Olympiad will open in the magnificent Olympic Stadium on Saturday as more than 2,000 athletes from thirty-eight nations compete in the fourteen-sport...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, July 23. -- California's nine-year vigil is nearly over. The games of the tenth Olympiad will open in the magnificent Olympic Stadium on Saturday as more than 2,000 athletes from thirty-eight nations compete in the fourteen-sport program.

headline.main: CURTIS WILL OPEN OLYMPICS SATURDAY; More Than 2,000 Athletes From 38 Nations to Compete in Games on Coast. 1,500,000 TICKETS SOLD Opening Pageant to Attract More Than 100,000 -- City Gay With Flags of Many Lands. AMERICAN TEAM IS STRONG Especially Well Fortified in Track and Field -- Invaders Present Formidable Array.

byline.original: By ARTHUR J. DALLEY.Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES.By ARTHUR J. DALEY

docs.snippet: Scoring a total of 45 1/2 points, Germany carried off the honors, considered by team achievements, in the ninth Olympic Games, held at Amsterdam in 1928. The United States was runner-up with 39 points, while Holland, with 34 1/2 points, took third...
docs.lead_paragraph: Scoring a total of 45 1/2 points, Germany carried off the honors, considered by team achievements, in the ninth Olympic Games, held at Amsterdam in 1928. The United States was runner-up with 39 points, while Holland, with 34 1/2 points, took third place.

headline.main: GERMANY GAINED 1928 TEAM HONORS; Triumphed Over Rival Nations in Olympics on Basis of All-Around Achievements. U.S. TOOK SECOND PLACE Many Sports Included In Tabulation -- Canada Won Women's Track and Field Competition.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 25 -- The committee of neutrals in the Chaco dispute between Bolivia and Paraguay refused to take the Bolivian note sent last night as a termination of the efforts for peace, and in a telegram today to La Paz asked Bolivia to make a...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 25 -- The committee of neutrals in the Chaco dispute between Bolivia and Paraguay refused to take the Bolivian note sent last night as a termination of the efforts for peace, and in a telegram today to La Paz asked Bolivia to make a declaration analogous to that of Paraguay, that she would not make an armed advance in the disputed region.
docs.abstract: Neutrals seek Bolivia's return to conf; Argentina hands note to Bolivia offering to withdraw mil mission to Paraguay if neutrality requires it

headline.main: RETURN OF BOLIVIA TO PARLEY SOUGHT; Neutrals at Washington Refuse to Accept Rejection of Over- tures for Peace as Final. PARAGUAY'S ATTITUDE CITED Her Delegates Have Returned, Ready to Resume Negotiations in Dispute Over Chaco's Ownership.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES, July 27 (AP). -- American chances of capturing the major share of Olympic rowing honors on the beautiful new course at Long Beach are especially bright this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, July 27 (AP). -- American chances of capturing the major share of Olympic rowing honors on the beautiful new course at Long Beach are especially bright this year.
docs.abstract: Chances of U S team bright

headline.main: Chances of U.S. in Olympic Rowing Tests Especially Bright This Year, Says Burke
